lead_paragraph: There was carnage and rubble and smoke and blood, but Prudence Bushnell will always remember the rattling of a teacup. Ms. Bushnell was the United States ambassador to Kenya when the embassy in Nairobi was demolished by a terrorist bomb. Her memory of the teacup as it chattered in the blast was just one detail of the catastrophe that permeated her 45-minute testimony yesterday at the embassy bombings trial.
abstract: Prudence Bushnell, former United States ambassador to Kenya, testifies at embassy bombings trial; describes in detail her escape from office tower behind embassy in Nairobi when bomb went off on Aug 7, 1998, and ensuing chaos; four defendants, accused of joining with Osama bin Laden in terrorist plot that led to blast, remain impassive throughout her 45-minute testimony; photo (M)
